instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data:
For pre-painted galvanized surfaces:
Sand lightly then wipe the surface with a clean rag before applying paint. Remove all loose paint film to sound surface. Spot prime bare substrate.
For corroded galvanized surfaces:
Remove rust by wire brushing and use BOYSEN®® Metal Etching Solution B‑71. Let it stay for 10-15 minutes before washing with water. Be sure to remove all remaining residue and dry completely. Solvent wipe then prime immediately.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Primer for bare substrate: BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer Red Oxide B‑2277 or BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer Gray B‑2230 Topcoat (2 – 3 coats): BOYSEN®® Acqua Epoxy™

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Check paint compatibility of the existing paint film to the desired new paint. Use only BOYSEN®® Epoxy Reducer B‑55 as thinning solvent for primer. BOYSEN®® Acqua Epoxy™ can be used as supplied. Immediately apply primer after surface preparation to avoid occurrence of flash rusting. Application of topcoat should be done within 7 days after priming to ensure good intercoat adhesion, otherwise re-application of primer is needed. Topcoat will reach full hardness after 7 days of drying.
